default.title: This service is not for emergencies.
default.body: If you are in immediate danger or at risk of harming yourself or others, please call 999 or attend A&E.

amber.title: If you feel unsafe at any point, please call 999 or attend A&E.
amber.body: We will contact you within 24–72 hours to arrange the next step.

red.title: We're concerned about your safety.
red.body: Please contact 999 now or attend your nearest A&E department. We cannot provide emergency support through this service.

landing.title: Get matched to the right mental health professional
landing.subtitle: This short assessment helps us understand what you're experiencing so we can safely recommend the most appropriate care.
landing.reassurance: Your answers are reviewed by qualified clinicians. We do not use automated diagnosis.

progress.tooltip: Most people complete this in one sitting. You can save and return at any time.

safety.title: Your safety matters
safety.body: The next questions ask about safety and risk. We ask everyone these questions — answering honestly helps us make sure you receive the right level of support.
safety.microReassurance: Your answers do not automatically mean emergency action. They help us plan care safely.

si.inlineSupport: Many people experience thoughts like these during periods of distress. Sharing this information helps us respond appropriately and safely.

submitted.title: Thank you — your information has been received
submitted.primary: A clinician will review your responses to determine the most appropriate next step in your care.
nextStepsList: We match you to the most suitable professional
You'll be able to book an appointment or we'll contact you if a review is needed
submitted.timeline: Most patients hear from us within 1–2 working days.

booking.title: Book your appointment
booking.pathwayExplanation: Based on your assessment, this is the most appropriate starting point for your care.
booking.clinicianTypeExplanation: You'll meet with a qualified clinician who specialises in concerns like yours. If at any point a different level of care is needed, we'll guide you through that.
booking.availabilityFraming: Appointments available as soon as this week.
booking.paymentRequired: Payment is required to confirm your appointment. This helps us reduce missed appointments and keep waiting times short.

reviewRequired.title: We're reviewing your assessment
reviewRequired.body: Some aspects of your assessment mean a clinician needs to review it before booking an appointment.
reviewRequired.reassurance: — it helps ensure your care is safe and appropriate.
nextStepsList: A clinician will review your information
We'll contact you to arrange the next step
reviewRequired.timeline: If your situation worsens or you feel unsafe, please call 999 or attend A&E.

red.title: We're concerned about your safety
red.primaryInstruction: Based on your responses, you may be at immediate risk. Please contact 999 now or attend your nearest A&E department.
red.boundary: We cannot provide emergency support through this service.
red.optionalSupport: If you're able to do so safely, consider contacting a trusted person to be with you.

checkIn.title: Checking in — how are you feeling?
checkIn.body: We're checking in while you're waiting for your appointment. This short check-in helps us notice if things have changed and whether additional support is needed.

escalated.title: We'd like to review your care plan
escalated.body: Your recent check-in suggests things may have become more difficult.
escalated.nextSteps: A clinician will review this and may contact you to discuss next steps.

appointmentConfirmed.title: Your appointment is confirmed
appointmentConfirmed.manageLink: Manage or reschedule in your patient portal.

override.title: Confirm clinical override
override.body: Please record your clinical rationale. This will be saved as part of the patient's record.

incidentPrompt.title: Create clinical incident record?
incidentPrompt.body: Use this to document safety concerns, escalation actions, and learning points.
